meanings.sent1: After the break, the teacher had to restimulate the students' interest in the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The coffee helped restimulate my energy levels after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved restimulating a seemingly dead flower back to life.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker's words were like a spark, restimulating hope in the audience.

meanings.definition: To cause to become active or lively again.
meanings.sent1: The music at the party was so lively, it restimulated everyone's dancing spirit.
meanings.sent2: A good joke can restimulate a dull conversation and make it more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie restimulated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent4: The rain after a dry spell restimulated the growth of the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was restimulating, motivating the team to give their best performance.
